get.description: Return the typed content for the user

parameters.name: userdn
parameters.description: User distinguished name, @me also meaning the current user

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The name of the content to retrieve for this user, like "photo" or "payload"

parameters.name: loginid
parameters.description: Assume that the userdn is actually a login id, that depends on the directory (email, short name...)

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Name of the provider to retrieve the content from. An empty value means the main directory

get.description: Return information on the current user

parameters.name: providers
parameters.description: List of providers to use, separated by a coma. A empty value means no provider, while the absence of the parameter means all available providers (default)

post.description: Same than get, except that the ids are passed in the POST body to support large arrays

parameters.name: providers
parameters.description: List of providers to use, separated by a coma. A empty value means no provider, while the absence of the parameter means all available providers (default)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Array of ids as a JSON array. It cannot be a simple string with a separator as the ids can contain separators themselves

get.description: Return information on multiple users at once. The users must be identified by DN, not login id

parameters.name: providers
parameters.description: List of providers to use, separated by a coma. A empty value means no provider, while the absence of the parameter means all available providers (default)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Array of ids as a JSON array. It cannot be a simple string with a separator as the ids can contain separators themselves

get.description: Return the information a user based on its DN

parameters.name: userdn
parameters.description: User distinguished name, @me also meaning the current user

parameters.name: loginid
parameters.description: Assume that the userdn is actually a login id, that depends on the directory (email, short name...)

parameters.name: providers
parameters.description: List of providers to use, separated by a coma. A empty value means no provider, while the absence of the parameter means all available providers (default)

basicAuth.description: HTTP Basic Authentication. Works over 'HTTP' and 'HTTPS'
